org.ezze.games.storekeeper
Interface GameGraphics

All Known Implementing Classes:
DesktopGameGraphics
public interface GameGraphics

Interface required to implement game's visual representation.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Dmitriy Pushkov

Method Summary
 int getActionSpritesCount()
          Retrieves worker's action sprites' count.

          Retrieves worker's shift as part of level item per one game's loop iteration.

          Retrieves background color of the game.

Method Detail

getGameLoopIterationTime

int getGameLoopIterationTime()
Retrieves game's loop iteration time in milliseconds.

Returns:
Loop iteration time in milliseconds

getAnimationStepShift

double getAnimationStepShift()
Retrieves worker's shift as part of level item per one game's loop iteration. It's strongly advised return value * N = 1.0, where N is action animation steps' count.

Returns:
Animation step's shift

getBackground

java.awt.Color getBackground()
Retrieves background color of the game.

Returns:
Background color

getIntroductionImage

java.awt.Image getIntroductionImage()
Retrieves game's introduction image.

Returns:
Introduction image

getSpriteDimension

java.awt.Dimension getSpriteDimension()
Retrieves sprite's dimension in pixels.

Returns:
Sprite dimension

getActionSpritesCount

int getActionSpritesCount()
Retrieves worker's action sprites' count. This count also includes worker's static position.

getLeftActionSprite

java.awt.Image getLeftActionSprite(int spriteIndex)
Retrieves animation sprite of the worker looking to the left.

Parameters:
spriteIndex - Animation sprite's index in the range [0; getActionSpritesCount() - 1]
Returns:
Worker's animation sprite

getRightActionSprite

java.awt.Image getRightActionSprite(int spriteIndex)
Retrieves animation sprite of the worker looking to the right.

Parameters:
spriteIndex - Animation sprite's index in the range [0; getActionSpritesCount() - 1]
Returns:
Worker's animation sprite

getBoxSprite

java.awt.Image getBoxSprite()
Retrieves box' sprite.

Returns:

getBoxInCellSprite

java.awt.Image getBoxInCellSprite()
Retrieves sprite of a box in a cell.

Returns:
Box in a cell sprite
